item.name: The medium time that was spent on expand BOM
The medium time that was spent on Login
The medium time that was spent on Logout
The High Load Process, more than {$PROCESS.ALARM}
CPU user time
item.description: The Processor Information\% User Time counter shows the percent of time that the processor(s) is spent executing in User mode.

item.name: Number of threads
item.description: The number of threads used by all running processes.

trigger.name: Has been detected the long manipulation with data in Teamcenter
Has been detected the long login time in Teamcenter

item.name: Network interfaces WMI get
item.key: wmi.getall[root\cimv2,"select Name,Description,NetConnectionID,Speed,AdapterTypeId,NetConnectionStatus from win32_networkadapter where PhysicalAdapter=True and NetConnectionStatus>0"]

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Inbound packets discarded
item_prototype.description: The number of incoming packets dropped on the network interface.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Inbound packets with errors
item_prototype.description: The number of incoming packets with errors on the network interface.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Bits received
item_prototype.description: Incoming traffic on the network interface.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Outbound packets discarded
item_prototype.description: The number of outgoing packets dropped on the network interface.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Outbound packets with errors
item_prototype.description: The number of outgoing packets with errors on the network interface.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Bits sent
item_prototype.description: Outgoing traffic on the network interface.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Speed
item_prototype.description: Estimated bandwidth of the network interface if any.

master_item.key: wmi.getall[root\cimv2,"select Name,Description,NetConnectionID,Speed,AdapterTypeId,NetConnectionStatus from win32_networkadapter where PhysicalAdapter=True and NetConnectionStatus>0"]

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Operational status
item_prototype.description: The operational status of the network interface.

master_item.key: wmi.getall[root\cimv2,"select Name,Description,NetConnectionID,Speed,AdapterTypeId,NetConnectionStatus from win32_networkadapter where PhysicalAdapter=True and NetConnectionStatus>0"]

trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link down
trigger_prototype.description:
This trigger expression works as follows: 1. Can be triggered if operations status is down. 2. {$IFCONTROL:\"{#IFNAME}\"}=1 - user can redefine Context macro to value - 0. That marks this interface as not important. No new trigger will be fired if this interface is down. 3. {TEMPLATE_NAME:METRIC.diff()}=1) - trigger fires only if operational status is different from Connected(2).
WARNING: if closed manually - won't fire again on next poll, because of .diff.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Interface type
item_prototype.description: The type of the network interface.

master_item.key: wmi.getall[root\cimv2,"select Name,Description,NetConnectionID,Speed,AdapterTypeId,NetConnectionStatus from win32_networkadapter where PhysicalAdapter=True and NetConnectionStatus>0"]

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template SPLM TC Client-Server Performance_nonstop:net.if.speed["{#IFNAME}"].change()}<0 and {Template SPLM TC Client-Server Performance_nonstop:net.if.speed["{#IFNAME}"].last()}>0 and ( {Template SPLM TC Client-Server Performance_nonstop:net.if.type["{#IFNAME}"].last()}=6 or {Template SPLM TC Client-Server Performance_nonstop:net.if.type["{#IFNAME}"].last()}=7 or {Template SPLM TC Client-Server Performance_nonstop:net.if.type["{#IFNAME}"].last()}=11 or {Template SPLM TC Client-Server Performance_nonstop:net.if.type["{#IFNAME}"].last()}=62 or {Template SPLM TC Client-Server Performance_nonstop:net.if.type["{#IFNAME}"].last()}=69 or {Template SPLM TC Client-Server Performance_nonstop:net.if.type["{#IFNAME}"].last()}=117 ) and ({Template SPLM TC Client-Server Performance_nonstop:net.if.status["{#IFNAME}"].last()}<>2)
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: ({Template SPLM TC Client-Server Performance_nonstop:net.if.speed["{#IFNAME}"].change()}>0 and {Template SPLM TC Client-Server Performance_nonstop:net.if.speed["{#IFNAME}"].prev()}>0) or ({Template SPLM TC Client-Server Performance_nonstop:net.if.status["{#IFNAME}"].last()}=2)
trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Ethernet has changed to lower speed than it was before
trigger_prototype.description: This Ethernet connection has transitioned down from its known maximum speed. This might be a sign of autonegotiation issues. Ack to close.

dependency.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link down
dependency.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and ({Template SPLM TC Client-Server Performance_nonstop:net.if.status["{#IFNAME}"].last()}<>2 and {Template SPLM TC Client-Server Performance_nonstop:net.if.status["{#IFNAME}"].diff()}=1)

trigger_prototype.expression: ({Template SPLM TC Client-Server Performance_nonstop:net.if.in["{#IFNAME}"].avg(15m)}>({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}/100)*{Template SPLM TC Client-Server Performance_nonstop:net.if.speed["{#IFNAME}"].last()} or {Template SPLM TC Client-Server Performance_nonstop:net.if.out["{#IFNAME}"].avg(15m)}>({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}/100)*{Template SPLM TC Client-Server Performance_nonstop:net.if.speed["{#IFNAME}"].last()}) and {Template SPLM TC Client-Server Performance_nonstop:net.if.speed["{#IFNAME}"].last()}>0
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: {Template SPLM TC Client-Server Performance_nonstop:net.if.in["{#IFNAME}"].avg(15m)}<(({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}-3)/100)*{Template SPLM TC Client-Server Performance_nonstop:net.if.speed["{#IFNAME}"].last()} and {Template SPLM TC Client-Server Performance_nonstop:net.if.out["{#IFNAME}"].avg(15m)}<(({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}-3)/100)*{Template SPLM TC Client-Server Performance_nonstop:net.if.speed["{#IFNAME}"].last()}
trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): High bandwidth usage ( > {$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}% )
trigger_prototype.description: The network interface utilization is close to its estimated maximum bandwidth.

dependency.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link down
dependency.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and ({Template SPLM TC Client-Server Performance_nonstop:net.if.status["{#IFNAME}"].last()}<>2 and {Template SPLM TC Client-Server Performance_nonstop:net.if.status["{#IFNAME}"].diff()}=1)

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template SPLM TC Client-Server Performance_nonstop:net.if.in["{#IFNAME}",errors].min(5m)}>{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"} or {Template SPLM TC Client-Server Performance_nonstop:net.if.out["{#IFNAME}",errors].min(5m)}>{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"}
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: {Template SPLM TC Client-Server Performance_nonstop:net.if.in["{#IFNAME}",errors].max(5m)}<{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"}*0.8 and {Template SPLM TC Client-Server Performance_nonstop:net.if.out["{#IFNAME}",errors].max(5m)}<{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"}*0.8
trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): High error rate ( > {$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"} for 5m)

dependency.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link down
dependency.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and ({Template SPLM TC Client-Server Performance_nonstop:net.if.status["{#IFNAME}"].last()}<>2 and {Template SPLM TC Client-Server Performance_nonstop:net.if.status["{#IFNAME}"].diff()}=1)

master_item.key: wmi.getall[root\cimv2,"select Name,Description,NetConnectionID,Speed,AdapterTypeId,NetConnectionStatus from win32_networkadapter where PhysicalAdapter=True and NetConnectionStatus>0"]
